channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Raised inspiration cover and tarmac degraded, 7th October
item.description:
Outside 24St Nicholas Drive GL50 4RY There is a raised inspection cover in badly RElayed tarmac. Tarmac is breaking up in small pieces that keep getting kicked away. Someone could trip

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, St Nicholas Drive, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Missing bollards, 7th October
item.description:
3 bollards missing, this has been reported before and closed with no action taken. Huge lorries now drive over this pavement (see pic) and have caused it to collapse. This now has to be repaired at taxpayers expense, due to the lack of action taken by the council.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Mill Street, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Complete bollard is damaged (Non illuminating bollard or post)

item.title: Trees that are overgrown and neglected, 7th October
item.description:
There are large branches falling off in windy conditions which may fall on pedestrians and property. These trees were maintained but have been left and are now dangerously large and neglected.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brook Close, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Previous road repair failing, 7th October
item.description:
There is an old road repair outside my house which has now failed. When HGV's and vans drive over it my whole house shakes. There is also a banging and thud noise created when vehicles pass over it. Myself and my young family are often woken to the banging of vehicle going over this road repair. The photo does the do the situation justice, I tried to upload a video of a HGV passing. Please can you rectify the repair?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
